depth.long_name: Depth of Vertical Layer Center Below Surface

gswp3-w5e5.title: GSWP3-W5E5
gswp3-w5e5.comments: Combination of W5E5 v2.0 ([Cucchi et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-2020-28), and [Lange et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.342217)) for 1979-2019 with GSWP3 v1.09 ([Kim, 2017](https://doi.org/10.20783/DIAS.501)) homogenized to W5E5 for 1901-1978. The homogenization reduces discontinuities at the 1978/1979 transition and was done using the ISIMIP3BASD v2.5.0 bias adjustment method ([Lange, 2019](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-12-3055-2019) and [Lange, 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4686991)). For further information see also <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/80/>

20crv3-w5e5.title: 20CRv3-W5E5
20crv3-w5e5.comments: Combination of W5E5 v2.0 for 1979-2019 with 20CRv3 (ensemble member 1) homogenized to W5E5 for 1901-1978. The homogenization was done in the same way as for GSWP3-W5E5.

20crv3-era5.title: 20CRv3-ERA5
20crv3-era5.comments: Combination of ERA5 for 1979-2021 with 20CRv3 (ensemble member 1) homogenized to ERA5 for 1901-1978. The homogenization was done in the same way as for GSWP3-W5E5.

20crv3.title: 20CRv3
20crv3.comments: Ensemble member 1 of NOAA-CIRES-DOE 20th Century Reanalysis version 3 ([Slivinski et al., 2019](https://doi.org/10.1002/qj.3598) and [Compo et al., 2011](https://doi.org/10.1002/qj.776)) interpolated to 0.5° spatial resolution.

chelsa-w5e5.title: CHELSA-W5E5
chelsa-w5e5.comments: CHELSA-W5E5 v1.0 is a downscaled version of the W5E5 v1.0 dataset, where the downscaling is done with the CHELSA v2.0 algorithm, which applies topographic adjustments based on surface altitude. For the high-resolution sensitivity experiments, this dataset is provided at its original resolution of 30 arcsec as well as in spatially aggregated form, at resolutions of 90 arcsec, 300 arcsec and 1800 arcsec. For more information see [Karger et al. (2022)](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.836809.2).

gfdl-esm4.title: GFDL-ESM4
gfdl-esm4.institution: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Geophysical Fluid Dynamics Laboratory, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA

ukesm1-0-ll.title: UKESM1-0-LL
ukesm1-0-ll.institution: Met Office Hadley Centre, Fitzroy Road, Exeter, Devon, EX1 3PB, UK

mpi-esm1-2-hr.title: MPI-ESM1-2-HR
mpi-esm1-2-hr.institution: Max Planck Institute for Meteorology, Hamburg 20146, Germany

ipsl-cm6a-lr.title: IPSL-CM6A-LR
ipsl-cm6a-lr.institution: Institut Pierre Simon Laplace, Paris 75252, France

mri-esm2-0.title: MRI-ESM2-0
mri-esm2-0.institution: Meteorological Research Institute, Tsukuba, Ibaraki 305-0052, Japan

cesm2.title: CESM2
cesm2.institution: National Center for Atmospheric Research, Boulder, CO 80305, USA

cesm2-omip2.title: CESM2-OMIP2
cesm2-omip2.comments: From CMIP6-OMIP activity forced by 1958-2018 JRA55-do atmospheric data set and initialized with observed physical and biogeochemical ocean data. Data on native grid was remapped to a 1° regular grid. For further experiment design details see <https://furtherinfo.es-doc.org/CMIP6.NCAR.CESM2.omip2.none.r1i1p1f1>

gfdl-mom6-cobalt2.title: GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2
gfdl-mom6-cobalt2.comments: JRA-55 driven MOM6-COBALT2 reanalysis. Data on native grid was remapped to a regular 0.25° and 1° grid. For further experiment design details see [Lui et al. (2021)](https://doi.org/10.1029/2021GL094367) and [DOI: 10.48364/ISIMIP.920945](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.920945)

climate.title: Climate related forcing
climate.description: Forcing data describing physical or chemical systems, in particular the climate, the oceans, and the cryosphere.

geo_conditions.title: Static geographic information
geo_conditions.description: Geographic or other time-independent information, such as land-sea masks, or river routing networks.

socioeconomic.title: Direct human forcing
socioeconomic.description: Independent additional forcing data, which influence climate impacts, such as land-use, population or economic changes.

landseamask.comment: This is the land-sea mask of the W5E5 dataset ([Cucchi et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-2097-2020); [Lange et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.342217)). Over all grid cells marked as land by this mask, all climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. For further information see also <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/41/>.

landseamask_water-global.comment: This is the generic land-sea mask from ISIMIP2b that is to be used for global water simulations in ISIMIP3. It marks more grid cells as land than **landseamask**. Over those additional land cells, the climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are not guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. Instead they may represent climate conditions over sea or a mix of conditions over land and sea.

countrymasks.comment: Country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.

countrymasks_fractional.comment: Fractional country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.

gswp3_hwsd.comment: One fixed pattern to be used for all simulation periods. Upscaled Soil texture map (30 arc sec. to 0.5°x0.5° grid) based on Harmonized World Soil Database v1.1 (HWSD, <https://www.fao.org/publications/card/en/c/2fa14e5e-ae97-516e-9dd2-24bc7abbc823/>) using the GSWP3 upscaling method A (<http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~sujan/research/gswp3/soil-texture-map.html>)

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

hwsd_soil_data_all_land.comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on all land.

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

hwsd_soil_data_on_cropland.comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on current cropland ([MIRCA2000 at 5 arc-minutes](https://doi.org/10.1029/2008GB003435)).

ddm30_basins_cru_neva.title: basins
ddm30_basins_cru_neva.comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

ddm30_flowdir_cru_neva.title: flowdir
ddm30_flowdir_cru_neva.comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

ddm30_slopes_cru_neva.title: slopes
ddm30_slopes_cru_neva.comment: DDM30 ([Döll & Lehner, 2002](https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0)). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

hypso_volume.title: Hypsographic: Volume
hypso_volume.comment: Level-Volume Hypsographic curves to be provided to your model (alternatively, you can also use the Level-Volume Hypsographic curves). Each hypsographic consist in 11 data pairs. Level refers to the level of the lake taking the lake bottom as the reference (in meters), Volume is the volume at the corresponding level (in km3). Calculated from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603>)). More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

hypso_area.title: Hypsographic: Area
hypso_area.comment: Level-Area Hypsographic curves to be provided to your model (alternatively, you can also use the Level-Volume Hypsographic curves). Each hypsographic consist in 11 data pairs. Level refers to the level of the lake taking the lake bottom as the reference (in meters), Area is the area at the corresponding level (in km2). Calculated from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603>)). More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

elevation.title: Lake Heigth
elevation.comment: Elevation (meters above sea level) for representative lakes calculated from Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

max_lakedepth.title: Maximum lake depth
max_lakedepth.comment: Maximum depth (meters) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves provided in this repository as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

mean_lakedepth.title: Mean lake depth
mean_lakedepth.comment: Mean depth (meters) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves provided in this repository as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

surface_area.title: Lake Surface Area
surface_area.comment: Surface area (km^2) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

volume.title: Lake Volume
volume.comment: Volume (km^3) for representative lakes calculated from from GLOBathy, the Global lakes Bathymetry Dataset, January 2022 ([Khazaei et al., 2022](https://doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.c.5243309.v1)), and Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)). We recommend using the area or volume hypsographic curves as inputs for your lake model. Use this file only if your lake model does not accept a full hypsographic curve as an input. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

hydrolakes_id_biglakes.title: HydroLAKES ID for big lakes
hydrolakes_id_biglakes.comment: File provided for reference, to relate Hydrolakes and GLOBathy database fields to the representative lakes. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

biglakes_mask.title: Biglakes mask
biglakes_mask.comment: File provided for reference, to produce global plots with conspicuous large lakes during figure production. To be used together with the file storing the big lakes IDs. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

hydrolakes_id.title: HydroLAKES ID
hydrolakes_id.comment: File provided for reference, to produce global plots with conspicuous large lakes during figure production. To be used together with the file storing the big lakes mask. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

bathymetry.title: Sea Floor Depth
bathymetry.comment: Grid cell level ocean depth GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2 was running with.

lme.title: Large Marine Ecosystems
lme.comment: Created from [LME shapefiles](https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/55c77722e4b08400b1fd8244) by ISIMIP data team.

default.title: Default
default.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

fullharm.title: Fully harmonized
fullharm.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmnon.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmnon.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated. Please contact the sector coordination to push on with this side branch.

landuse-totals.title: Landuse totals

variables.long_name: share of managed pastures or rangeland

landuse-totals.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information on the land use data refer to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/82/>.

landuse-5crops.title: Downscaling to 5 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated C3 annual crops
share of rainfed C3 annual crops
share of irrigated C3 perennial crops
share of rainfed C3 perennial crops
share of irrigated C3 N-fixing crops
share of rainfed C3 N-fixing crops
share of irrigated C4 annual crops
share of rainfed C4 annual crops
share of irrigated C4 perennial crops
share of rainfed C4 perennial crops

landuse-5crops.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

landuse-15crops.title: Downscaling to 15 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated Oil crops groundnut
share of rainfed Oil crops groundnut
share of irrigated Oil crops rapeseed
share of rainfed Oil crops rapeseed

landuse-15crops.comment: The C4 perennial crops are not further downscaled from the "5 crops" data set and currently only include sugarcane.  Similarly, the C3 perennial crops are not downscaled either. The data is derived from the "5 crops" LUH2 data, and the crops have been downscaled to 15 crops according to the ratios given by the Monfreda data set ([Monfreda, Ramankutty, and Foley, 2008](https://doi.org/10.1029/2007GB002947)).

landuse-pastures.title: Managed pastures and rangeland
landuse-pastures.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

landuse-urbanareas.title: Urban areas
landuse-urbanareas.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

n-fertilizer-5crops.title: Nitrogen deposited by fertilizers on croplands

variables.long_name: N input through fertilizer on cropland with C3 annual crops

n-fertilizer-5crops.comment: Based on the LUH2 v2h data set (see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/28/>.

comment.ISIMIP3a: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 ([Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1)). Data for 2015-2021 is assumed to be same as that in 2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.
comment.ISIMIP3b: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) ([SPARC newsletter n° 40](https://www.geo.fu-berlin.de/met/ag/strat/publikationen/docs/Eyring-et-al_SPARC-Newsletter40.pdf)). Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

comment.ISIMIP3a: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 ([Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1)). Data for 2015-2021 is assumed to be same as that in 2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.
comment.ISIMIP3b: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) ([SPARC newsletter n° 40](https://www.geo.fu-berlin.de/met/ag/strat/publikationen/docs/Eyring-et-al_SPARC-Newsletter40.pdf)). Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

ggcmi-crop-calendar-phase3.title: GGCMI crop calendar for Phase 3

variables.long_name: Planting day, separated for rainfed and irrigated crops where applicable
Maturity day, separated for rainfed and irrigated crops where applicable

ggcmi-crop-calendar-phase3.comment: Reference: [Jägermeyr et al. 2021](https://doi.org/10.1038/s43016-021-00400-y). Data: [Jägermeyr et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5062513). So far, only a crop calendar, which is static in time is available. It is labeled as 2015soc, but can also be used for histsoc simulations, e.g. in combination with time-varying fertilizer inputs.

reservoirs-dams.comment: [Lehner et al. (2011a)](https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK), [Lehner et al. (2011b)](https://dx.doi.org/10.1890/100125), and Jida Wang et al. (KSU/Kansas State University, personal communication, data starting in 2016). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications. Please contact <info@isimip.org> in case of questions.

water_abstraction.title: Water abstraction for domestic and industrial purposes
water_abstraction.comment: For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08. This data is based ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project ([Wada et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-175-2016)) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

forest_management.title: Forest management
forest_management.comment: [Reyer et al. (2019)](https://doi.org/10.5880/PIK.2019.008), and [Reyer et al. (2020)](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-1295-2020) management prescribes stem numbers remaining after harvest, management data is annual but not every year has data.

wood_harvesting.title: Wood harvesting

variables.long_name: wood harvest area from primary forest land
wood harvest area from primary non forest land
wood harvest area from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest area from secondary young forest land
wood harvest area from secondary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary young forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary non forest land

wood_harvesting.comment: Historic annual country-level wood harvesting data. Based on the LUH2 v2h Harmonization Data Set ([Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). Interpolated to a 0.5° grid using first-order conservative remapping and calculated over a fractional country mask (<https://gitlab.pik-potsdam.de/isipedia/countrymasks/-/blob/master/>) derived from [ASAP-GAUL](https://data.europa.eu/euodp/data/dataset/jrc-10112-10004). For further information see <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/83/>

pctlake.title: Lake area fraction
pctlake.comment: Lake and reservoir area fraction/percentage calculated from the Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)) and GRanDv1.3 databases ([Lehner et al., 2011](https://doi.org/10.1890/100125)) mapped to 0.5 degrees resolution, time steps represent increasing reservoirs in their construction year, as given by GRanDv1.3 Reservoirs from 2017 onwards are kept constant. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

population-gridded.title: Population (gridded)
population-gridded.comment: Historical population data are based on the 2019 Revision of the United Nations World Population Prospects ([United Nations, 2019](https://population.un.org/wpp/)). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

population-countrylevel.title: Population (country-level)

variables.long_name: total number of people per country

population-countrylevel.comment: Historical population data are based on the 2019 Revision of the United Nations World Population Prospects ([United Nations, 2019](https://population.un.org/wpp/)). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

gdp.title: GDP
gdp.comment: Historic country-level GDP data are based on GDP per capita estimates from the WDI (1965-2020). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

InputData.title: Input Data
InputData.description: The data used to drive the impact models, exactly as described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

SecondaryInputData.title: Secondary Input Data
SecondaryInputData.description: Data that have been derived from or are related to the input data, but not described in the simulation protocol (e.g. with a differnt spatial or temporal resolution).

OutputData.title: Output Data
OutputData.description: The climate-impacts simulation data provided by participating modelling groups, corresponding to the output variables described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

SecondaryOutputData.title: Secondary Output Data
SecondaryOutputData.description: Data that have been derived by processing the ISIMIP output data, but do not correspond to output variables described in the simulation protocol.

ISIMIP3a.title: ISIMIP3a simulation round
ISIMIP3a.description: Historical model evaluation and attribution runs

ISIMIP3b.title: ISIMIP3b simulation round
ISIMIP3b.description: GCM-based simulations assuming fixed 2015 direct human influences for the future

default.description: For all experiments other than the sensitivity experiments.

1901co2.description: CO₂ concentration fixed at 1901 levels as a deviation from the “obsclim” climate + CO₂ forcing.

nowatermgt.description: No water management (e.g. no human water abstraction, no reservoirs) while other direct human forcings such as land use changes are considered according to histsoc or 2015soc.

nofire.description: Simulation with fire switched off to identify impact of fire within the model.

1955-riverine-input.description: For fisheries and marine ecosystems sector. JRA55 driven GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2 ocean climate with constant riverine nutrient and freshwater influx.
1955-riverine-input.description_note: Climate forcing to be taken from the `ctrlclim` inputs.

30arcsec.description: Observed climate forcing using 30arcsec resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.

90arcsec.description: Observed climate forcing using 90arcsec resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.

300arcsec.description: Observed climate forcing using 300arcsec resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.

1800arcsec.description: Observed climate forcing using 1800arcsec resolution used for sensitivity runs to determine the best spatial resolution of climate input data for impact models.

60arcmin.description: For fisheries and marine ecosystems sectors. Low resolution sensitivity experiment. JRA55 driven GFDL-MOM6-COBALT2 ocean climate on one degree spatial resolution.

w5e5.description: Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.

nobasd.description: Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).

localbc.description: Refers to local data from weather stations used for the bias-correction in e.g. the forest sector.

hyytiala.title: Hyytiälä
hyytiala.comment: Note that an experimental plot of pine contains a lot of data while footprint of flux tower is larger. Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

peitz.title: Peitz
peitz.comment: Managed using a weak thinning from below.

kroof.title: Kranzberg Roof Project
kroof.comment: Unmanaged/ thinning from below in past 20 years for all species.

qtot.comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

qs.comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

qsb.comment: Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.

qr.comment: For models that consider both diffuse and focussed/localised recharge this should be the sum of both; other models should submit the groundwater recharge component that the model simulates. See also the descriptions in qrf and qrd.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

qrf.comment: Water that directly flows from a surface water body into the groundwater layer below. Only submit if the model separates focussed/localised recharge from diffuse recharge.

qrd.comment: Groundwater recharge from water that enters the groundwater layer via percolation through the soil. Only submit if the model separates focussed/localised recharge from diffuse recharge. For models that do not simulate groundwater this can be seepage instead of recharge.

qg.comment: Water that leaves the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.

dis.comment: River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

evap.comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

potevap.comment: As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

soilmoist.comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

rootmoist.comment: Total simulated soil moisture available for evapotranspiration. Please indicate the depth of the root zone for each vegetation type in your model. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
rootmoist.long_name: Soil Moisture Content at Root Zone

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

soilmoistfroz.comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

tsl.comment: Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

snd.comment: Grid cell mean depth of snowpack.

swe.comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

tws.comment: Mean monthly water storage in all compartments. Please indicate in the netcdf metadata which storage compartments are considered.

canopystor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in the canopy.

glacierstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in glaciers.

groundwstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in groundwater layer.

lakestor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in lakes (except reservoirs).

wetlandstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in wetlands.

riverstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in rivers.

reservoirstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in reservoirs.

triver.comment: Mean monthly water temperature in river (representative of the average temperature across the channel volume).

pirrww.comment: Irrigation water withdrawn in case of optimal irrigation (i.e. eliminating water stress for the plants). This includes the plant's water requirements over and above precipitation and soil moisture, as well as any losses due to conveyance or irrigation inefficiencies considered.
pirrww.long_name: Potential Irrigation Water Withdrawal (assuming unlimited water supply)

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

airrww.comment: Irrigation water withdrawal, taking water availability into account; please provide if computed.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

pirruse.comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, assuming unlimited water supply.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

pirnreqcum.comment: Soil water demand required to avoid water stress accumulated across the growing season, excluding any water losses associated with application or transport and without constraints due to water availability; only needed for `firr` simulations.
pirnreqcum.long_name: Cumulative Potential Net Irrigation Water Requirement

airruse.comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, taking water availability into account; if computed.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

airrusegreen.comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed.
airrusegreen.long_name: Actual Irrigation Green Water Consumption on Irrigated Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

pirrusegreen.comment: Potential evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed and different from AIrrUseGreen.
pirrusegreen.long_name: Potential Irrigation Green Water Consumption on Irrigated Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

arainfusegreen.comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over rainfed cropland; if computed.
arainfusegreen.long_name: Actual Green Water Consumption on Rainfed Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

atotuse.comment: Sum of actual consumptive water use from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

ptotww.comment: Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) water withdrawal from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

ptotuse.comment: Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) consumptive water use from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

ainduse.comment: If computed. There is no need to submit ainduse if its components are being submitted separately (ainduse = amanuse + aelecuse).

aindww.comment: If computed. There is no need to submit aindww if its components are being submitted separately (aindww = amanww + aelecww).

pinduse.comment: If computed. There is no need to submit pinduse if its components are being submitted separately (pinduse = pmanuse + pelecuse).

pindww.comment: If computed. There is no need to submit pindww if its components are being submitted separately (pindww = pmanww + pelecww).

soil.comment: Soil type as used by your model. Please include a description of each type in the model documentation (under "Other data sets used"). Please also include a link to a database/paper describing the parameters and values associated with these soil types.

yield.comment: Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production. Yields are reported per growing seasons and not per year.

evapcum.comment: Evapotranspiration = sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation aggregated across the growing season.

initrcum.comment: Integral of the total nitrogen application rate over the growing season. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, the nitrogen application should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).

plantday.comment: As Julian dates. The planting date reported here corresponds to the actual planting date in the simulation and may differ from the prescribed crop calendar planting date in rare cases as certain models may delay prescribed planting for a few days to have more suitable soil moisture and temperature conditions.

anthday.comment: Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of anthesis.

matyday.comment: Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of maturity.

harvyear.comment: Usually the year when maturity is reached. Can also be computed from planting and maturuty day.

biom.comment: The whole plant biomass above ground.
biom.long_name: Total Above Ground Biomass Dry Matter Yields

amphibianprob.comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

birdprob.comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻². Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻²Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.

cvegag.long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Vegetation Biomass

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻². Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.

cvegbg.long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Species information is essential. Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.

clitterag.long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

comment.forestry: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. Species information is essential.
comment.other: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

clitterbg.long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation.
comment.peat: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
comment.other: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential.

comment.biomes: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.fire: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.peat: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).

csoillayer.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool in each layer

cproduct.comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation.
cproduct.long_name: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and Species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

gpp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

ra.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (plant) Respiration on Land

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

npp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and Species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

rh.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land

ffire.comment: Total C emitted from all fires (including deforestation and peat fire C emission).
ffire.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to C Emission from Fire

comment.other: Total area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time (including peat and deforestation fires).

nbp.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.
nbp.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land

fluc.comment: For wood products only. Sum of carbon fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emissions from previous years.
fluc.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Land Use Change

fgrazing.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
fgrazing.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Grazing

fcropharvest.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
fcropharvest.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting

flitter.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
flitter.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation to Litter

flittersoil.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
flittersoil.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil

flittersoillayer.comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “flittersoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
flittersoillayer.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil in each layer

fvegsoil.comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
fvegsoil.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

fvegsoillayer.comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “fvegsoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
fvegsoillayer.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil in each layer

fapar.comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
fapar.long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation

comment.forestry: Stand total and species information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.
comment.water_global: If used by, or computed by the model. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.

pft.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.

intercep.comment: The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

ccwd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris

hei.comment: For models including natural regeneration this variable may not make sense, please report domhei.

domhei.comment: Mean height of the 100 highest trees per hectare.

harv.comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

stemno.comment: DBH-Class Resolution: Either DBH-Classes or Total per Species
stemno.long_name: Remaining Stem Number after Disturbance and Management by DBH-Class

age.comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

mortstemno.comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species
mortstemno.long_name: Removed Stem Numbers by DBH-Class by Natural Mortality

harvstemno.comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species
harvstemno.long_name: Removed Stem Numbers by DBH-Class by Management

nlitterag.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

nlitterbg.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

comment.other: Soil nitrogen excluding belowground litter if your model reports nlitterbg. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report nsoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil nitrogen for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil nitrogen integrated over the entire soil depth. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).

strat.comment: 1 if lake grid cell is thermally stratified, 0 if lake grid cell is not thermally stratified
strat.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

thermodepth.comment: Depth corresponding the maximum water density gradient
thermodepth.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

watertemp.comment: Depth resolution: Full Profile. Simulated water temperature. Layer averages and full profiles.
watertemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

surftemp.comment: Average of the upper layer in case not simulated directly.
surftemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

bottemp.comment: Average of the lowest layer in case not simulated directly.
bottemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

ice.comment: 1 if ice cover is present in lake grid cell, 0 if no ice cover is present in lake grid cell
ice.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

lakeicefrac.comment: Depth resolution: Mean epi. Fraction of mass of a given layer taken up by ice.
lakeicefrac.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

icethick.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

snowthick.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

icetemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

snowtemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

sensheatf.comment: At the surface of the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.
sensheatf.long_name: Sensible Heat Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface

resolution.lakes_global: Representative lake associated with grid cell
resolution.lakes_local: Representative lake associated with grid cell

latentheatf.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.
latentheatf.long_name: Latent Heat Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface
latentheatf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

momf.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.
momf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

swup.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. Not to be confused with net shortwave radiation.
swup.long_name: Upward Short-Wave Radiation Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface
swup.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

lwup.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. Not to be confused with net longwave radiation.
lwup.long_name: Upward Long-Wave Radiation Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface
lwup.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

lakeheatf.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. the residual term of the surface energy balance, i.e. the net amount of energy that enters the lake on daily time scale: lakeheatf = swdown - swup + lwdown - lwup - sensheatf - latenheatf (terms defined positive when directed upwards)
lakeheatf.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Lake-Atmosphere Interface
lakeheatf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

turbdiffheat.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Only if computed by the model.
turbdiffheat.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

lakealbedo.comment: Albedo of the lake surface interacting with the atmosphere (water, ice or snow).
lakealbedo.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

landalbedo.comment: Albedo of the land surface interacting with the atmosphere. Average of pfts, snow cover, bare ground.

extcoeff.comment: Only to be reported for global models, local models should use extcoeff as input.
extcoeff.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

sedheatf.comment: Positive if upwards. Only if computed by the model.
sedheatf.long_name: Sediment Upward Heat Flux at Lake-Sediment Interface
sedheatf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

chl.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Total water chlorophyll concentration – indicator of phytoplankton.
chl.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

phytobio.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Different models will have different numbers of functional groups so that the reporting of these will vary by model.
phytobio.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

zoobio.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Total simulated Zooplankton biomass.
zoobio.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

tp.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.
tp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

pp.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.
pp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

tpd.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Some models may also output data for soluble reactive phosphorus (SRP).
tpd.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

tn.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.
tn.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

pn.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.
pn.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

tdn.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Some models may also output data for Nitrate (N02) nitrite (NO3) and ammonium (NH4).
tdn.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

do.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.
do.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

comment.lakes_global: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Not always available.
comment.lakes_local: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Not always available.

doc.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

si.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Not always available.
si.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

tcb.comment: All consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

tcblog10.comment: If the model is size-structured, please provide biomass in equal log 10 g weight bins (1-10g, 10-100g, 100g-1kg, 1-10kg, 10-100kg, >100kg)
tcblog10.long_name: Total Consumer Biomass Density in log10 Weight Bins

tpb.comment: All pelagic consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

bp30cm.comment: If a pelagic species and L infinity is <30 cm, include in this variable

bp30to90cm.comment: If a pelagic species and L infinity is >=30 cm and <90cm, include in this variable
bp30to90cm.long_name: Biomass Density of Medium Pelagics >=30cm and <90cm

bp90cm.comment: If a pelagic species and L infinity is >=90cm, include in this variable

tdb.comment: All demersal consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

bd30cm.comment: If a demersal species and L infinity is <30 cm, include in this variable

bd30to90cm.comment: If a demersal species and L infinity is >=30 cm and <90cm, include in this variable
bd30to90cm.long_name: Biomass Density of Medium Demersals >=30cm and <90cm

bd90cm.comment: If a demersal species and L infinity is >=90cm, include in this variable

tc.comment: Catch at sea (commercial landings plus discards, fish and invertebrates)
tc.long_name: Total Catch (all commercial functional groups / size classes)

tclog10.comment: If the model is size-structured, please provide biomass in equal log 10 g weight bins (1-10g, 10-100g, 100g-1kg, 1-10kg, 10-100kg, >100kg)
tclog10.long_name: Total Catch in log10 Weight Bins

tpc.comment: Catch at sea of all pelagic consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

cp30cm.comment: Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity <30 cm

cp30to90cm.comment: Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity >=30 cm and <90 cm
cp30to90cm.long_name: Catch Density of Medium Pelagics >=30cm and <90cm

cp90cm.comment: Catch at sea of pelagic species with L infinity >=90 cm

tdc.comment: Catch at sea of all demersal consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

cd30cm.comment: Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity <30 cm

cd30to90cm.comment: Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=30 cm and <90 cm
cd30to90cm.long_name: Catch Density of Medium Demersals >=30cm and <90cm

cd90cm.comment: Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=90 cm

ancold.comment: For ERF models, this occurs when temperature is below threshold (e.g., minimum mortality temperature (MMT)). Report 0 if temperature above threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
ancold.long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Cold

anheat.comment: Temperature above threshold (ERFs). Report 0 if temperature below threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
anheat.long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Heat

btm.comment: To be reported as annual series of mean daily total mortality, or as a single number of mean daily mortality; to be used for computations of attributable fractions. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

pop.comment: Baseline population data should be provided for computations of mortality rates (i.e. deaths per total population). See Section ‎5.1.6. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

burntarealuc.comment: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.
burntarealuc.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change

burntareapeat.comment: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from peatland fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.
burntareapeat.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Peat Fire

ffirepeat.comment: C emitted from peat fires (if simulated). Should also be part of ffire.

ffireluc.comment: C emitted from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of ffire.
ffireluc.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change

fireints.comment: If calculated, weighted by burned area. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

cfuel.comment: Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.

ccfuel.comment: (between 0 and 1), fraction of fuel combusted in a fire. Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
ccfuel.long_name: Combustion Completeness of Different Fuel Classes

mfuel.comment: As a fraction of fuel dry mass (not percentage). Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
mfuel.long_name: Fuel Moisture for Different Fuel Classes

firenrperc95.comment: 95th percentile of number of fires in one day during the month

firemortality.comment: Fraction of area covered by trees

firesize.comment: Monthly mean weighted with the number of fires of each day

firesizeperc95.comment: 95th percentile of fire size computed during the month

fireduration.comment: Mean needs to be weighted with the number of fires

fireros.comment: Mean needs to be weighted with burned area
fireros.long_name: Weighted Mean Fire Rate of Spread

canopyheight.comment: Mean height of canopy formed by trees over 5m.  Vegetation of less than 5m should be excluded from the canopy height calculation (i.e. not contributing with zero)

lowcover.comment: Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation less than 5 m tall

highcover.comment: Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation more than 5 m tall

cellarea.comment: The total area associated with each grid cell in the model.

contfrac.comment: The fraction of each grid cell that is assumed to be continent, i.e., not ocean. Should be 0 if the entire cell is assumed to be ocean, 1 if the entire cell is assumed to be covered by land or inland water bodies.

wetlandch4.comment: Net upward flux of methane from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
wetlandch4.long_name: Grid averaged methane emissions from wetland

ch4.comment: If possible, provide CH₄ emissions for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
ch4.long_name: Total Surface Carbon Mass Flux into CH4 emissions

wetlandfrac.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.
wetlandfrac.frequency: monthly, else annual (or fixed if static)

rsoillayer.comment: If possible, provide soil respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If you do not report layers, the depth dimension is 1. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
rsoillayer.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land of pools with different turnover time in each layer

rsoil.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land

verticalcflux.comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
verticalcflux.long_name: Vertical Carbon Mass Flux between layers

rlitter.comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
rlitter.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Litter Respiration on Land in each layer

nvegag.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above Ground Vegetation Biomass

nvegbg.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass

nmineral.comment: Can be split into nMineralNH4, mineral ammonium in the soil and nMineralNO3 mineral nitrate in the soil. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

nproduct.comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed nitrogen should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation .
nproduct.long_name: Nitrogen in Products of Land Use Change

fngasfire.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire.
fngasfire.long_name: Total Nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (including NHx, N2O, N2) from fire

fngas.comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
fngas.long_name: Total nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

fnleach.comment: Leaching means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil.
fnleach.long_name: Total nitrogen loss due to leaching or runoff (sum of ammonium, nitrite and nitrate)

fnfert.comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area.
fnfert.long_name: Total nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure)

nloss.long_name: Total nitrogen lost (including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and leaching)

fnproduct.long_name: Nitrogen in deforested or harvested biomass as a result of anthropogenic land-use or change

fnanthdisturb.long_name: Nitrogen mass flux out of land due to any human activity

fnveglitter.long_name: Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation to litter

fnvegsoil.long_name: Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation directly to soil

fnlittersoil.long_name: Total nitrogen mass flux from litter to soil

fbnf.comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

fnh3.comment: Surface upward flux of ammonia (NH3) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

fn2o.comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

fndep.long_name: Dry and wet deposition of reactive nitrogen onto land

fnnetmin.comment: If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
fnnetmin.long_name: Net nitrogen release from soil and litter as the outcome of nitrogen immobilisation and gross mineralisation

rhlayer.comment: If possible, provide heterotrophic respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide heterotrophic respiration integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
rhlayer.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land in each layer

fbioenergyharvest.comment: Refers to secondary bioenergy crops and should not be included in fcropharvest-total. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
fbioenergyharvest.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Bioenergy Harvesting

peattypefrac.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by the natural, drained, restored or mineral (i.e. not peat) peat types. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). Report only one year if fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

peatdepth.comment: Thickness of peat layer. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). Report only one year if fixed depth is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

hydcon.comment: Hydraulic conductivity at saturation. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

smsat.comment: Volumetric fraction of pore space in soil. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

wt.comment: Water table level relative to the ground surface. Note that a negative value should depict a water table below the soil surface. If the model works with subgrid topographic variation (microtopography approach in peatlands), the reference soil surface for **wt** is represented by the mean elevation of the soil surface. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

sm5.comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
sm5.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -5 hPa

sm15.comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
sm15.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -15 hPa

sm50.comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
sm50.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -50 hPa

sm330.comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
sm330.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -330 hPa

sm15000.comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
sm15000.long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -15000 hPa

wf.comment: Grid fraction that is flooded, i.e. where the water table is above ground surface. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

drainagedepth.comment: Depth of drainage of artificial drainage network. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

drainagedensity.comment: Density of drainage network as total length of drainage network per km². Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

socage.comment: Age of soil carbon. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

datasets.comment: Factual climate input datasets: GSWP3-W5E5, 20CRv3-W5E5, 20CRv3-ERA5, 20CRv3.

Tracks from IBTrACS database ([Knapp et al. 2010](https://doi.org/10.1175/2009BAMS2755.1)) (period 1841-2021), Windfields calculated by Holland model ([Holland 1980](https://doi.org/10.1175/1520-0493(1980)108%3C1212:AAMOTW%3E2.0.CO;2), [Holland 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/2008MWR2395.1)).
Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303).
GFDL MOM6/COBALTv2 simulations driven by reanalysis-based atmospheric forcing ([Liu et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.1029/2021GL094367)).
Hourly coastal water levels with long-term trends for impact attribution.
1850-2005: [Meinshausen et al. (2011)](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z), 2006-2021: [Dlugokencky & Tans (2022)](https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/)
1850-2014: [Meinshausen et al. (2017)](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-10-2057-2017), 2015-2021: [Dlugokencky (2022)](https://gml.noaa.gov/ccgg/trends_ch4/)
Detrended versions of the GSWP3-W5E5, 20CRv3-W5E5, 20CRv3-ERA5, 20CRv3 data sets derived by the Attrici method.

We do not provide "no climate change" TC tracks and windfields but the original tracks from the IBTrACS database ([Knapp et al. 2010](https://doi.org/10.1175/2009BAMS2755.1)) (period 1841-2021) windfields calculated by Holland model ([Holland 1980](https://doi.org/10.1175/1520-0493(1980)108%3C1212:AAMOTW%3E2.0.CO;2), [Holland 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/2008MWR2395.1)) should be used in combination with the counterfactual water levels to estimate the impacts of sea level rise on TC induced damages, losses or replacement.

We do not provide "no climate change" lightning data. Instead the original Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303) should be used in the **counterclim** set-up.
We do not provide any counterfactual oceanic forcings, i.e. there is no "no climate change" experiment proposed for the fisheries and marine ecosystems sector.
Detrended version of the **obsclim** hourly coastal water levels.
1901 levels ([CO2] = 296.13 ppm) of observed atmospheric CO2 concentrations according to [Meinshausen et al. (2011)](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z).
1901 levels of atmospheric CH4 concentrations ([CH4] = 928.8004 ppb), according to [Meinshausen et al. (2017)](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-10-2057-2017).

spinclim.description: Detrended version of the observed climate related forcing used to spin-up the simulations based on a stable 1900 climate

transclim.description: Last 50 years of the splinclim climate forcing data

ctrlclim.description: Climate related input data for the riverine influx sensitivity experiment

picontrol.description: GCM-based pre-industrial climate related forcing, CO₂ and CH₄ concentrations fixed at 1850 levels.

datasets.comment: Bias-adjusted data, generated by GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0, and UKESM1-0-LL within CMIP6.

Synthetic tropical cyclone tracks derived from the five CMIP6 GCMs considered within ISIMIP3b (GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0, UKESM1-0-LL) and by two different statistical downscaling approaches ([Emanuel et al., 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-89-3-347) and the Columbia HAZard model (CHAZ), [Lee et al. (2018)](https://doi.org/10.1002/2017MS001186));
Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303).
Generated by GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, and UKESM1-0-LL within CMIP6. The data has been mapped to a 1° regular grid.
Not available yet, but we plan to provide hourly water levels derived from the atmospheric forcings described above combined with long-term sea-level trends.
1850 levels of atmospheric CO₂ concentrations ([CO2] = 284.73 ppm), according to Meinshausen et al. (2011, <https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z>).
1850 levels of atmospheric CH₄ concentrations ([CH4] = 808.249 ppb), according to Meinshausen et al. (2017, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-10-2057-2017>).

historical.description: GCM-based historical climate related forcing, historical changes in CO₂ and CH₄ concentrations.

datasets.comment: Bias-adjusted data, generated by GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0, and UKESM1-0-LL within CMIP6.

Synthetic tropical cyclone tracks derived from the five CMIP6 GCMs considered within ISIMIP3b (GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0, UKESM1-0-LL) and by two different statistical downscaling approaches ([Emanuel et al., 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-89-3-347) and the Columbia HAZard model (CHAZ), [Lee et al. (2018)](https://doi.org/10.1002/2017MS001186));
Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303).
Generated by GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, and UKESM1-0-LL within CMIP6. The data has been mapped to a 1° regular grid.
Not available yet, but we plan to provide hourly water levels derived from the atmospheric forcings described above combined with long-term sea-level trends.
1850-2005: [Meinshausen et al. (2011)](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z), 2006-2014: [Dlugokencky & Tans (2022)](https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/)
From [Meinshausen et al. (2017)](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-10-2057-2017)

ssp126.description: GCM-based climate related forcing according to SSP1-2.6.

datasets.dataset: GCM-based climate forcing according to SSP1-2.6
datasets.comment: Bias-adjusted data, generated by GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0, and UKESM1-0-LL within CMIP6.

Synthetic tropical cyclone tracks derived from the five CMIP6 GCMs considered within ISIMIP3b (GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0, UKESM1-0-LL) and by two different statistical downscaling approaches ([Emanuel et al., 2008](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-89-3-347) and the Columbia HAZard model (CHAZ), [Lee et al. (2018)](https://doi.org/10.1002/2017MS001186));
Flash Rate Monthly Climatology from [Cecil (2006)](https://doi.org/10.5067/LIS/LIS-OTD/DATA303).

datasets.dataset: GCM-based oceanic climate forcing according to SSP1-2.6
datasets.comment: Generated by GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, and UKESM1-0-LL within CMIP6. The data has been mapped to a 1° regular grid.
Not available yet, but we plan to provide hourly water levels derived from the atmospheric forcings described above combined with long-term sea-level trends.
