histsoc.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period.
histsoc.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

datasets.comment: HYDE-based irrigated and rainfed cropland downscaled to up to 15 crops, managed pasture and grassland, urban areas. The data originates from the historic [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)) and the Monfreda data set ([Monfreda et al, 2008](https://doi.org/10.1029/2007GB002947)).

Historical annual country-level wood harvesting data based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).

Historical annual land-use transformation data, based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).

Historical annual fertilization rates, based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).
NHx and NOy deposition simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI), see [Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.759077.1).
Observation-based representation of recent average planting and maturity dates not accounting for changes over time ([Jägermeyr et al. 2021](https://www.nature.com/articles/s43016-021-00400-y)).
Adopted from [Rousseau et al. (2019)](https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1820344116).

The data is based on [Lehner et al. (2011a)](https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK), [Lehner et al. (2011b)](https://doi.org/10.1890/100125), and Jida Wang et al. (KSU/Kansas State University, personal communication, data starting in 2016). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications.

For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by the WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08 models (1850-202118). This data is based on ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project ([Wada et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-175-2016)) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

Lake and reservoir area fraction/percentage calculated from the Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://www.nature.com/articles/ncomms13603)) and GRanDv1.3 databases ([Lehner et al., 2011](https://esajournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1890/100125))
Observed stem numbers, thinning type, planting numbers from and common management practices for 9 forest sites in Europe from [Reyer et al. (2020)](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-1295-2020).

National and gridded historical population data. Estimates are available for total as well as urban and rural population counts. The population data are adopted from HYDE v3.3 (private communication with K. Klein Goldewijk, to be published).
Based on the [World Development Indicator database (WDI)](https://databank.worldbank.org/source/world-development-indicators).

HYDE-based irrigated and rainfed cropland downscaled to up to 15 crops, managed pasture and grassland, urban areas. The data originates from the historic [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)) and the Monfreda data set ([Monfreda et al, 2008](https://doi.org/10.1029/2007GB002947)).

Historical annual country-level wood harvesting data based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).

Historical annual land-use transformation data, based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).

Historical annual fertilization rates, based on the [LUH v2h Harmonization Data Set](https://luh.umd.edu) (see [Hurtt et al. 2011](https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0153-2); [Hurtt et al. 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020)).
NHx and NOy deposition simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI), see [Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.759077.1).
Observation-based representation of recent average planting and maturity dates not accounting for changes over time ([Jägermeyr et al. 2021](https://www.nature.com/articles/s43016-021-00400-y)).
Adopted from [Rousseau et al. (2019)](https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1820344116)

The data is based on [Lehner et al. (2011a)](https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK), [Lehner et al. (2011b)](https://doi.org/10.1890/100125), and Jida Wang et al. (KSU/Kansas State University, personal communication, data starting in 2016). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications.

For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by the WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08 models (1850-202118). This data is based on ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project ([Wada et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-175-2016)) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

Lake and reservoir area fraction/percentage calculated from the Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://www.nature.com/articles/ncomms13603)) and GRanDv1.3 databases ([Lehner et al., 2011](https://esajournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1890/100125))
Observed stem numbers, thinning type, planting numbers from and common management practices for 9 forest sites in Europe from [Reyer et al. (2020)](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-1295-2020).

Based on the [World Development Indicator database (WDI)](https://databank.worldbank.org/source/world-development-indicators).

1850soc.description: Fixed year-1850 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
1850soc.description_note: Please label your simulations `1850soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-1850 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings. This scenario may be thought of an approximation of pre-industrial levels of human impacts.

1901soc.description: Fixed year-1901 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
1901soc.description_note: Please only label your model run `1901soc` if it does not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-1901 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings. This scenario may be thought of an approximation of pre-industrial levels of human impacts.

2015soc.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
2015soc.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-2015 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

2015soc-from-histsoc.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort) for the future period, if the historical period was using varying direct human influences in the historical period.
2015soc-from-histsoc.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc-from-histsoc` for the future period, if your model run extends a historical period which used the `histsoc` scenario. This distinguishes the data from experiments which use both `2015soc` in the past and the future. If your model output is identical for both cases, please only submit the `2015soc` files for the future period.

nat.description_note: Please only label your model run `nat` if it does not at all account for any direct human forcings, including e.g. human land use or fishing. For Nitrogen deposition please use 1850soc values or specify which other preindustrial value you used in the model documentation.
